content.description: You will be asked you to identify rhythms. After a question is announced, you will have ten seconds to read the choices. It is important that you read the choices carefully before the example is played. Each example will be played twice, with a brief pause between playings.
content.question: Which of the following is played?

choices.label: Score A has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. The score has three measures with the time signature of two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score A is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted eighth, and sixteenth. The pitches are: A2, B2, C3, and D3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score A is: sixteenth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are E3, D3, C3, and B2. The final measure of score A has a half note A2.

Score B has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. The score has three measures with the time signature of two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score B is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, dotted eighth, and sixteenth. The pitches are: A2, B2, C3, and D3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score B is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are E3, D3, C3, and B2. The final measure of score B has a half note A2.

Score C has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. The score has three measures with the time signature of two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score C is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are: A2, B2, C3, and D3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score C is: sixteenth, dotted eighth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are E3, D3, C3, and B2. The final measure of score C has a half note A2.

Score D has one staff in the bass clef. There are no key signatures. The score has three measures with the time signature of two four time. The rhythm in measure 1 of score D is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are: A2, B2, C3, and D3. The rhythm in measure 2 of score D is: dotted eighth, sixteenth, sixteenth, and dotted eighth. The pitches are E3, D3, C3, and B2. The final measure of score D has a half note A2.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
